meanings.definition: Having eight sets of homologous chromosomes in a cell or organism.
meanings.sent1: The octoploid cell contained eight sets of matching chromosomes.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the octoploid organism with great interest.
meanings.sent3: The octoploid cell was so organized, it color-coded its chromosomes for fun.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was an octoploid puzzle, each set of thoughts neatly aligned.
meanings.sent5: The octoploid structure of the DNA made it incredibly stable and resilient.

meanings.definition: An organism or cell with eight sets of homologous chromosomes.
meanings.sent1: The octoploid displayed unique genetic traits due to its chromosome count.
meanings.sent2: Researchers discovered a new octoploid species in the deep sea.
meanings.sent3: The octoploid cell threw a party to celebrate its extra chromosomes.
meanings.sent4: In the field of genetics, she was known as the octoploid queen.
meanings.sent5: The octoploid organism stood out in the ecosystem with its diverse genetic makeup.
